intro: Symplocos fordii, commonly known as the Chinese beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, bright purple berries that appear in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green, with a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various bird species.
